question: Which two nations share the location of "Mount Nimba Strict Nature Reserve"?
option4: Canada and United States of America
explanation: Guinea and Cote d'Ivoire share the location of Mount Nimba Strict Nature Reserve. It is a protected area and a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It is located within the Nimba Mountain Range. The highest peak is Mount Richard-Molard. It is the highest peak in both countries. It forms the origin of Cavalli, Cestos and Sassandra Rivers. It lies within the Guinean Forests of West Africa Biodiversity Hotspot.
